title: Why Britain's small towns are seeing big house price growth
text:
In music, film, and literature, small towns tend to get a hard rap; they are the narrow-minded prisons that suffocated teens dreaming of escaping. In reality, a small town can be a fantastic place to live: walkable and filled with community spirit, but large enough to have far more choice than if you were stuck out in the boondocks.

Small towns – specifically those with a population of between 30,000 and 50,000 people – with good commuter links to big cities also have the ability to buck the downward trend when it comes to price growth. Over the past decade these small towns around London have recorded impressive price growth, according to exclusive research by Savills.
